slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचअभयं सत्त्वसंश‍ुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थिति: ।दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: Fearlessness, purity of heart, steadfastness in the yoga of knowledge, charity, self-control, sacrifice, study of the scriptures, austerity, and straightforwardness.

slokas: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्याग: शान्तिरपैश‍ुनम् ।दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्‍त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: Non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, tranquility, absence of slander, compassion towards all beings, absence of greed, gentleness, modesty, and lack of restlessness.

slokas: तेज: क्षमा धृति: शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता ।भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: Vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, absence of malice, and modesty are the qualities of a person born with divine endowments, O Bharata.

slokas: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोध: पारुष्यमेव च ।अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: Hypocrisy, arrogance, pride, anger, harshness, and ignorance are the qualities of those born with demonic nature, O Partha.

slokas: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता ।मा श‍ुच: सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: The divine qualities are deemed for liberation, while the demonic qualities are for bondage. Do not grieve, O son of Pandu, you are born with divine qualities.

slokas: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च ।दैवो विस्तरश: प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे श‍ृणु ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: In this world, there are two types of beings created: the divine and the demonic. The divine has been described at length; hear from me about the demonic, O Partha.

slokas: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुरा: ।न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: Neither do the demonic people know what is to be done nor what is not to be done; neither purity, nor proper conduct, nor truth is found in them.

slokas: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् ।अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: They say that the world is unreal, without a foundation, without a God, born of mutual union, and what else but lust is its cause?

slokas: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धय: ।प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माण: क्षयाय जगतोऽहिता: ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Relying on this view, lost in themselves and of small intelligence, they engage in fierce actions meant for the destruction of the world, being its enemies.

slokas: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विता: ।मोहाद्‍गृहीत्वासद्‍ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽश‍ुचिव्रता: ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: Relying on insatiable desire, filled with hypocrisy, pride, and arrogance, and holding onto false views through delusion, they engage in impure practices.

slokas: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिता: ।कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिता: ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: They are absorbed in immeasurable anxiety, ending only with death, and are convinced that the gratification of desires is the highest goal.

slokas: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धा: कामक्रोधपरायणा: ।ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Bound by hundreds of ties of hope, given over to desire and anger, they strive to accumulate wealth by unjust means for the gratification of desires.

slokas: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् ।इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम्  ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: This has been gained by me today; I shall attain this desire. This wealth is mine now, and this will also be mine in the future.

slokas: असौ मया हत: शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि ।ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: I have killed this enemy, and I will kill others too. I am the lord, I am the enjoyer, I am successful, I am powerful and happy.

slokas: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया ।यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिता: ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: "I am wealthy and of noble birth. Who else is there like me? I will sacrifice, I will give, I will rejoice." Thus are they deluded by ignorance.

slokas: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृता: ।प्रसक्ता: कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽश‍ुचौ ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: Bewildered by many thoughts, enveloped in the net of delusion, attached to the enjoyment of desires, they fall into a foul hell.

slokas: आत्मसम्भाविता: स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विता: ।यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: The self-conceited, stubborn, filled with the intoxication of wealth and pride, perform sacrifices in name only, with hypocrisy, disregarding the prescribed rules.

slokas: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिता: ।मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयका: ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who are absorbed in ego, strength, arrogance, desire, and anger, who are envious and malicious towards others and towards Me in their own bodies and in others.

slokas: तानहं द्विषत: क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् ।क्षिपाम्यजस्रमश‍ुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: Those cruel haters, the lowest among men in the world, I constantly cast into demonic wombs.

slokas: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि ।मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: Those who take birth in demonic wombs, deluded birth after birth, fail to reach Me, O son of Kunti, and thus they go to the lowest destination.

slokas: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मन: ।काम: क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्‍त्रयं त्यजेत् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: This is the threefold gate of hell, destructive of the self: desire, anger, and greed. Therefore, one should abandon these three.

slokas: एतैर्विमुक्त: कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नर: ।आचरत्यात्मन: श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: Freed from these three gates of darkness, O son of Kunti, a person acts for the welfare of the soul and thereby attains the supreme destination.

slokas: य: शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारत: ।न स सिद्धिमवाप्‍नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: He who disregards the scriptural injunctions and acts according to his own desires neither attains perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme goal.

slokas: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ ।ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Therefore, the scripture is your authority in determining what should be done and what should not be done. Knowing the injunctions of the scripture, you ought to perform your duty here.
